metadata.title: CVE-2019-12269 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Certified (focal) - low
metadata.description:
Enigmail before 2.0.11 allows PGP signature spoofing: for an inline PGPmessage, an attacker can cause the product to display a "correctly signed"message indication, but display different unauthenticated text.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-12269` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

enigmail - 2:2.0.11+ds1-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: enigmail package in focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2:2.0.11+ds1-1').
